intro: Pericalymma ellipticum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed mistflower, is a small, herbaceous plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic shrubs. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, whitish bloom, giving it a silvery appearance. Its small, white flowers are typically clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences, which bloom during the spring and summer seasons. Pericalymma ellipticum is often found in rocky or sandy soils in arid or semi-arid regions.
